Description.val:
The Surface Warfare (SUW) MP increases firepower and offensive/defensive capabilities against large numbers of highly maneuverable, fast, small craft threats, giving LCS the ability to protect the sea lanes and move a force quickly through a choke point or other strategic waterway. With the SUW MP embarked, LCS has enhanced detection and engagement capability against enemy small craft and similar littoral surface threats. 

The SUW MP is composed of the Gun Mission Module (GMM), Maritime Security Module (MSM), Surface-to-Surface Missile Module (SSMM), and an Aviation Module.  The SUW MP with the GMM, MSM, and Aviation Module (with the MH-60R) achieved Initial Operational Capability in FY 2014.  The GMM comprises of two high velocity 30mm cannons to augment the ship's 57mm gun and the MSM supports the embarkation of visit, board, search, and seizure (VBSS) teams. 

Six deployable SUW MPs with GMM & MSM have been delivered to the Fleet and three more are in production. An SUW MP is deployable and capable of meeting its focused mission requirements on an LCS only when it includes the full complement of Common Mission Modules Equipment (Line Item Number 1600) and the full complement of mission systems that composed of the LCS SUW Mission Module (Line Item Number 1603). 

The program will increase capability of the SUW MP with the addition of the MQ-8 Fire Scout Vertical Take-off and Landing Tactical Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (VTUAV) for the detection, identification, and classification of surface contacts, and a Surface-to-Surface Missile Module (SSMM) to meet the long range engagement capability against surface threats.

Other Related Budgets: BLIs: OPN 1600, OPN 1601, OPN 1602, WPN 4221, RDT&E 0603596N

[P40A / SU001 - GUN MODULE]: The gun mission module (GMM) is comprised of two high velocity 30mm cannons to augment the ship's 57mm gun, and embarked support aircraft (MH-60R helicopter with Hellfire missile and the MQ-8B Fire Scout Vertical Take-off and Landing Tactical Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (VTUAV)) for the detection, identification, and classification of surface contacts.

[P40A / SU002 - SURFACE-TO-SURFACE MISSILE MODULE (SSMM)]: The Surface-to-Surface Missile Module (SSMM) will provide in-close engagement capability against surface threats.

[P40A / SURFACE-TO-SURFACE MISSILE MODULE]: The program plans to conduct a Production Readiness Review (PRR) in 2Q FY19 to inform a production decision to support planned SSMM procurements beginning in FY 2019.  To ensure that planned procurements are low risk, results from integration (including combat system and software integration efforts) on both the Freedom and Independence variant hulls and formal testing completed on the Freedom variant hull Q1 FY2019 will inform the production decision.  These risk reduction efforts include results from 152 missile shots conducted on two odd hull platforms (LCS 5 and 7), successful embark/debark events on both hull variants (includes an end-to-end integration and TRACKEX event on an Independence variant hull), and validation and verification of the SSMM Technical Data Package (TDP).

[P40A / SU003 - MARITIME SECURITY MODULE]: The Maritime Security Module (MSM) provides LCS with the capability to conduct Level II visit, board, search and seizure (VBSS) operations and the ability to conduct anti-piracy and maritime interdiction missions. This budget line procures hardware for a full MSM that includes two 11 meter Rigid Hull Inflatable Boats (RHIB), two boat cradles, a VBSS Allowance Equipment List (AEL) for communications and tactical equipment, and habitability and support containers. Funding also includes production, assembly, installation and checkout of all mission system components.

[P40A / SU900 - CONSULTING SERVICES]: Provides program management support, engineering and technical support, studies, analysis and evaluation on mission module systems.

Justification.val: FY 2020 funding will procure two Surface to Surface Mission Modules (SSMM), as well as associated production engineering and consulting services.

Name.@footnote: Production Engineering is required 24 months after procurement to fund factory acceptance testing in year of delivery.
